message: Thanks for the fast reply. I was surprised why is not implemented timeout mechanism by default in many *Async methods (probably all?). For example SslStream.AuthenticateAsClientAsync. The whole process of connection, initiation of TLS session and authentication need "manual" implementation of timeouts. In addition in case of timeout, the async task has not only be terminated but some resources must be freed explicitly. If something is not done correctly, it will be harder to detect resource leaks.
